senses.de: A project or activity that is difficult and needs a lot of effort to complete
senses.ex: Starting a new enterprise is always a risky decision.

Tips.title: Effort Requirement
Tips.description: Use this sense of 'enterprise' when discussing projects that require significant effort and commitment.
Tips.example: She devoted herself fully to the educational enterprise.

Tips.title: Risk Awareness
Tips.description: Often implies a notable risk or challenge involved in the project being referenced.
Tips.example: Their latest enterprise could revolutionize the industry, but it's filled with uncertainty.

senses.de: The ability or wish to do something new and clever, despite the risks
senses.ex: People admire his energy and enterprise.

Tips.title: Creativity Highlight
Tips.description: Highlights the innovative and creative aspects of making bold decisions or actions.
Tips.example: She was recognized for her enterprise in navigating the market's changes.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Usually used in a positive light, praising someone's ambition or daring nature.
Tips.example: He showed great enterprise by taking on the leadership role with little experience.

senses.ex: The new policy will be beneficial to small and medium enterprises.

Tips.title: Business Context
Tips.description: Refers to all forms of businesses, from small startups to large corporations, often used in economic discussions.
Tips.example: She built a thriving enterprise from the ground up.

Tips.title: Company Scale
Tips.description: Used to indicate the size and scope of a business, not just its legal form.
Tips.example: The grant was earmarked for small and medium-sized enterprises.

senses.de: A difficult plan, especially one that involves risk
senses.ex: They are on an enterprise to sail around the world.

Tips.title: Adventurous Undertone
Tips.description: Carries an undertone of adventure or exploration, often used for ambitious plans or journeys.
Tips.example: Their sailing enterprise took them across uncharted seas.

senses.de: The readiness to embark on bold new ventures
senses.ex: Entrepreneurs are known for their spirit of enterprise.

Tips.title: Entrepreneurial Spirit
Tips.description: Explains the enthusiasm and proactive stance required to start new ventures, typically linked to entrepreneurship.
Tips.example: The new startup exudes a contagious spirit of enterprise.

senses.de: A system or software that manages an organization's data and processes
senses.ex: The company has recently updated their enterprise software system.

Tips.title: Tech Applications
Tips.description: Focuses on enterprise as software solutions or systems designed for organizations, a common term in the tech industry.
Tips.example: Their enterprise system helped integrate all their business processes.

Business.wordDefinition:
Business usually refers to a company, organization, or individual who is selling or providing goods or services, with the goal of making a profit.

Enterprise usually refers to a large or complex business organization that involves many different parts or aspects, which may include multiple departments or projects, and may need significant planning and coordination.

For example, a small bakery might be referred to as a business, while a large international conglomerate that produces many different products and services might be called an enterprise.

Company.wordDefinition:
The words company and enterprise are often used interchangeably but they have different meanings.

A company is a specific type of business entity that is formed by a group of people or an individual.

A company can be a small business or a large corporation, and can operate in a variety of industries.

A company is a specific type of business organization, while an enterprise refers to any project or initiative aimed at achieving a particular goal.

Both terms can describe a business, but company is more specific, while enterprise is more general.

Initiative.wordDefinition:
Initiative refers to taking action or starting something new. It is applicable when referring to an individual or group of individuals.

For example, "Samantha took the initiative to start a community garden."

Enterprise refers to a large business, while initiative refers to taking action to start something new.

Organization.wordDefinition:
Enterprise usually refers to a large and complex business venture, while the word organization refers to a structured group of people working together to achieve a common goal.

Enterprise could be used to describe a big company or a new business venture, while organization could refer to non-profit groups or sports teams.

Enterprise is mostly used to describe a business while organization can be used for various groups or associations.

Project.wordDefinition:
It involves ongoing planning, management, and investment, and often includes various projects as part of its operations.

A project refers to a specific endeavor that has a defined scope, timelines, and goals. It is a temporary effort that aims to deliver a unique product, service, or result.

Projects are usually managed separately within an enterprise, and can require different skills, resources, and approaches.

An enterprise is like a big umbrella organization that consists of many different projects. An enterprise usually focuses on long-term goals and overall strategy, while a project is a temporary effort focused on achieving specific objectives within a set timeframe.

Both enterprise and project management are important for business success.

Scheme.wordDefinition:
A scheme refers to a plan or proposal to accomplish a specific goal or objective.

Schemes can be related to various fields, including social, economic, or political.

Schemes can be applicable in different contexts such as education, social welfare, urban development, housing, or charity.

In summary, enterprises are focused on creating a profitable business venture that provides value to customers, while schemes are focused on plans or proposals to accomplish a specific goal or objective in a particular field.

Undertake.wordDefinition:
It can be an idea or a venture that requires hard work and dedication to succeed. Undertake, on the other hand, means to commit oneself to do something.

An example of the use of the word enterprise is in the sentence "Starting a business is a risky enterprise." An example of the use of the word undertake is in the sentence "I will undertake the responsibility of taking care of the dog while you're away."

Enterprise is more applicable in the context of starting or running a business or a major project, while undertake is more applicable in the context of accepting a task or responsibility.

Venture.wordDefinition:
Venture refers to a project or business that involves a certain amount of risk, uncertainty, and experimentation.

Venture is usually taken up by individuals who are looking for new and innovative opportunities where the outcome is uncertain.

In simpler terms, an enterprise is an established and successful business, while a venture is a new and risky business or project.

quotes.Text: Americans want and deserve a broad array of health insurance choices so they can identify those that best fit their own individual or family needs. These choices expand when we allow free enterprise to foster innovation, not smother it with taxes and one-size fits all ideology.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Fred Upton

quotes.Text: In business, I believe that if you focus only on the journey, you'll miss the whole point of the enterprise. There has to be a goal, an end game of some kind; otherwise, you're just spinning your wheels. Yes, the journey is important, but the destination is important, too.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Ivanka Trump

quotes.Text: Self-reliance - that's a dirty word to Democrats. They want people to believe that self-reliance means you don't do anything with anybody. They don't want it thought of as accepting responsibility for one's life. Enterprise. Imagination. Independence. Entrepreneurism.

quotes.Name: Rush Limbaugh

quotes.Text: It'll be all of our efforts together. It won't won't ever be exactly the way I imagined it. And that is, I think, an important lesson as well, is that in any group enterprise it's going to be the sum total of the group.

quotes.Name: James Cameron

quotes.Text: We're learning that, when it comes to enterprise users or otherwise, privacy is very important. Some features might work well for enterprise customers and may not work for consumers. You've got to have balance.

quotes.Name: Eric Yuan

quotes.Text: At Netflix, we think you have to build a sense of responsibility where people care about the enterprise. Hard work, like long hours at the office, doesn't matter as much to us. We care about great work.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Reed Hastings

quotes.Text: Science is an enterprise that should be cherished as an activity of the free human mind. Because it transforms who we are, how we live, and it gives us an understanding of our place in the universe.

quotes.Name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.Text: The question really is, are you improving the world? And you can do that in many models. You can do that in government, you can do that in a nonprofit, and you can do it in commercial enterprise.

quotes.Name: Jeff Bezos

quotes.Text: It is the lone worker who makes the first advance in a subject; the details may be worked out by a team, but the prime idea is due to enterprise, thought, and perception of an individual.
quotes.Title: Scottish Scientist
quotes.Name: Alexander Fleming

quotes.Text: I support the free enterprise system, and I want companies to make money, but they shouldn't be reaping profits from the deaths of their employees or former employees.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gene Green
